Course Description: The course aims at familiarizing the student with the concept of Financial Risk and the various instruments available for risk management. In the course of running a business, decisions are made in the presence of risk. Some risks are related to the nature of business. These risks are called business risks. Another class of risks deal with uncertainty of such factors as interest rates, exchange rates, stock prices and commodity prices. These are called financial risks. Although our financial system is replete with risks it also provides a means of dealing with these risks, in form of derivatives. Derivatives have been in existence for centuries, their growth has accelerated rapidly during the last 30 years or so. They are now used widely by corporations, financial institutions, professional investors and individuals.

Prerequisites.Mandatory: ECO331 or ECO332 Foundations of Finance OR Valuation and portfolio Management

Course Outcomes.CO1: Understand the concept of risk in finance
Course Outcomes.CO2: Understand the principles of option pricing and apply option strategies in risk management
Course Outcomes.CO3: Understand frontiers of risk management like weather and energy derivatives
Course Outcomes.CO5: Apply the principles of pricing forwards and futures and application of hedging strategies

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Concept of Risk: Business Risk, Financial Risk, Exchange Risk, Liquidity Risk, Country Risk Introduction to the various derivative instruments
The Options Market, Option payoff and strategies
Principles of Option Pricing, Binomial Model and The Black Scholes (BS) Model
Structure of Forward and Futures Markets, Future Hedging Strategies

Resource Material.Textbook (Primary): Options, Futures and other Derivatives. John C.Hull (Pearson Education)
Resource Material.Other References: An Introduction to Derivatives and Risk Management, Don M. Chance
Resource Material.Derivatives: Fred D. Arditti (Harvard Business School Press)
